Test: Parametric Bootstrap - Bivariate

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2020-07-06

Source: vignettes/tests/test_pb_bivariate.Rmd
test_pb_bivariate.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(MASS)
library(jeksterslabRboot)
context("Test Parametric Bootstrap - Bivariate.")

Parameters

n <- 1000
B <- 1000
rho <- runif(
  n = 1,
  min = .5,
  max = .8
)
theta <- rho
Sigma <- matrix(
  data = c(
    1,
    rho,
    rho,
    1
  ),
  nrow = 2
)
mu <- c(0, 0)
var_thetahat <- ((1 - rho^2)^2) / n
se_thetahat <- sqrt(var_thetahat)
# Parameters
Variable <- c(
  "`rho`"
)
Description <- c(
  "Population correlation."
)
Notation <- c(
  "$\\rho$"
)
Value <- c(
  theta
)
knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Variable,
    Description,
    Notation,
    Value
  ),
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Population Parameter"
)
Population Parameter
Variable Description Notation Value
rho Population correlation. \(\rho\) 0.7495053 
# Sampling distribution of theta
Variable <- c(
  "`n`",
  "`theta`",
  "`var_thetahat`",
  "`se_thetahat`"
)
Description <- c(
  "Sample size.",
  "Population correlation.",
  "Variance of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation.",
  "Standard error of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation."
)
Notation <- c(
  "$n$",
  "$\\theta = \\rho$",
  "$\\mathrm{Var} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\frac{ \\left( 1 - \\rho^2 \\right)^2}{n}$",
  "$\\mathrm{se} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\frac{ 1 - \\rho^2 }{\\sqrt{n}}$"
)
Value <- c(
  n,
  theta,
  var_thetahat,
  se_thetahat
)
knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Variable,
    Description,
    Notation,
    Value
  ),
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Sampling Distribution of $\\hat{\\theta}$ with Known Parameter"
)
Sampling Distribution of \(\hat{\theta}\) with Known Parameter
Variable Description Notation Value
n Sample size. \(n\) 1000.0000000
theta Population correlation. \(\theta = \rho\) 0.7495053
var_thetahat Variance of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation. \(\mathrm{Var} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \frac{ \left( 1 - \rho^2 \right)^2}{n}\) 0.0001921
se_thetahat Standard error of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation. \(\mathrm{se} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \frac{ 1 - \rho^2 }{\sqrt{n}}\) 0.0138584

Generate Data

X <- mvrnorm(
  n = n,
  Sigma = Sigma,
  mu = mu
)
str(X)
#>  num [1:1000, 1:2] -0.844 1.132 0.657 -1.422 0.917 ...
#>  - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2
#>   ..$ : NULL
#>   ..$ : NULL
hist(X[, 1])

qqnorm(X[, 1])
qqline(X[, 1])

hist(X[, 2])

qqnorm(X[, 2])
qqline(X[, 2])

plot(X[, 1], X[, 2])

Estimate Correlation

rhohat <- cor(X)[2, 1]
thetahat <- rhohat
varhat_thetahat <- ((1 - rhohat^2)^2) / (n - 2)
sehat_thetahat <- sqrt(varhat_thetahat)
ci <- cor.test(X[, 1], X[, 2])
ci_ll <- ci$conf.int[1]
ci_ul <- ci$conf.int[2]
Variable <- c(
  "`n`",
  "`thetahat`",
  "`varhat_thetahat`",
  "`sehat_thetahat`"
)
Description <- c(
  "Sample size.",
  "Sample correlation.",
  "Estimate of the variance of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation.",
  "Estimate of the standard error of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation."
)
Notation <- c(
  "$n$",
  "$\\hat{\\theta} = \\hat{\\rho}_{x, y} = \\frac{\\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \\left(x_i - \\hat{\\mu}_{x} \\right) \\left(y_i - \\hat{\\mu}_{y} \\right)}{\\sqrt{\\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \\left( x_i -  \\hat{\\mu}_{x} \\right)^2} \\sqrt{\\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \\left( y_i -  \\hat{\\mu}_{y} \\right)^2}}$",
  "$\\widehat{\\mathrm{Var}} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\frac{ \\left( 1 - \\hat{\\rho}^2 \\right)^2}{n - 2}$",
  "$\\widehat{\\mathrm{se}} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\frac{ 1 - \\hat{\\rho}^2 }{\\sqrt{n - 2}}$"
)
Value <- c(
  n,
  thetahat,
  varhat_thetahat,
  sehat_thetahat
)
knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Variable,
    Description,
    Notation,
    Value
  ),
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Sample Statistics (Parameter Estimates)"
)
Sample Statistics (Parameter Estimates)
Variable Description Notation Value
n Sample size. \(n\) 1000.0000000
thetahat Sample correlation. \(\hat{\theta} = \hat{\rho}_{x, y} = \frac{\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \left(x_i - \hat{\mu}_{x} \right) \left(y_i - \hat{\mu}_{y} \right)}{\sqrt{\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \left( x_i - \hat{\mu}_{x} \right)^2} \sqrt{\sum_{i = 1}^{n} \left( y_i - \hat{\mu}_{y} \right)^2}}\) 0.7342067
varhat_thetahat Estimate of the variance of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation. \(\widehat{\mathrm{Var}} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \frac{ \left( 1 - \hat{\rho}^2 \right)^2}{n - 2}\) 0.0002129
sehat_thetahat Estimate of the standard error of the sampling distribution of the sample correlation. \(\widehat{\mathrm{se}} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \frac{ 1 - \hat{\rho}^2 }{\sqrt{n - 2}}\) 0.0145908

Bootstrap

X_star <- pb_mvn(
  data = X,
  B = B
)
thetahat_star <- sapply(
  X = X_star,
  FUN = function(X) cor(X)[2, 1]
)
mean_thetahat_star <- mean(thetahat_star)
var_thetahat_star <- var(thetahat_star)
sd_thetahat_star <- sqrt(var_thetahat_star)
Variable <- c(
  "`B`",
  "`mean_thetahat_star`",
  "`var_thetahat_star`",
  "`sd_thetahat_star`"
)
Description <- c(
  "Bootstrap samples.",
  "Mean of $B$ sample correlations.",
  "Variance of $B$ sample correlations.",
  "Standard deviation of $B$ sample correlations."
)
Notation <- c(
  "$B$",
  "$\\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( \\cdot \\right) = \\frac{1}{B} \\sum_{b = 1}^{B} \\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( b \\right)$",
  "$\\widehat{\\mathrm{Var}}_{\\mathrm{B}} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\frac{1}{B - 1} \\sum_{b = 1}^{B} \\left[ \\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( b \\right) - \\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( \\cdot \\right) \\right]^2$",
  "$\\widehat{\\mathrm{se}}_{\\mathrm{B}} \\left( \\hat{\\theta} \\right) = \\sqrt{ \\frac{1}{B - 1} \\sum_{b = 1}^{B} \\left[ \\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( b \\right) - \\hat{\\theta}^{*} \\left( \\cdot \\right) \\right]^2 }$"
)
Value <- c(
  B,
  mean_thetahat_star,
  var_thetahat_star
)
Value <- c(
  B,
  mean_thetahat_star,
  var_thetahat_star,
  sd_thetahat_star
)
knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Variable,
    Description,
    Notation,
    Value
  ),
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Parametric Bootstrapping Results"
)
Parametric Bootstrapping Results
Variable Description Notation Value
B Bootstrap samples. \(B\) 1.00000e+03
mean_thetahat_star Mean of \(B\) sample correlations. \(\hat{\theta}^{*} \left( \cdot \right) = \frac{1}{B} \sum_{b = 1}^{B} \hat{\theta}^{*} \left( b \right)\) 7.34059e-01
var_thetahat_star Variance of \(B\) sample correlations. \(\widehat{\mathrm{Var}}_{\mathrm{B}} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \frac{1}{B - 1} \sum_{b = 1}^{B} \left[ \hat{\theta}^{*} \left( b \right) - \hat{\theta}^{*} \left( \cdot \right) \right]^2\) 2.02500e-04
sd_thetahat_star Standard deviation of \(B\) sample correlations. \(\widehat{\mathrm{se}}_{\mathrm{B}} \left( \hat{\theta} \right) = \sqrt{ \frac{1}{B - 1} \sum_{b = 1}^{B} \left[ \hat{\theta}^{*} \left( b \right) - \hat{\theta}^{*} \left( \cdot \right) \right]^2 }\) 1.42314e-02

Bootstrap Sampling Distribution

hist(
  thetahat_star,
  breaks = 100,
  main = expression(
    paste(
      "Histogram of ",
      hat(theta),
      "*"
    )
  ),
  xlab = expression(
    paste(
      hat(theta),
      "*"
    )
  )
)

qqnorm(thetahat_star)
qqline(thetahat_star)

Confidence Intervals

wald_out <- wald(
  thetahat = thetahat,
  sehat_thetahat = sehat_thetahat,
  eval = TRUE
)
pc_out <- pc(
  thetahat_star = thetahat_star,
  thetahat = thetahat,
  wald = TRUE,
  eval = TRUE
)
bc_out <- bc(
  thetahat_star = thetahat_star,
  thetahat = thetahat,
  wald = TRUE,
  eval = TRUE
)
bca_out <- bca(
  thetahat_star = thetahat_star,
  thetahat = thetahat,
  data = X,
  fitFUN = function(X) cor(X)[2, 1],
  wald = TRUE,
  eval = TRUE
)
knitr::kable(
  x = as.data.frame(
    rbind(
      wald = wald_out,
      pc = pc_out,
      bc = bc_out,
      bca = bca_out
    )
  ),
  caption = "Confidence Intervals"
)
Confidence Intervals
statistic p se ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95 zero_hit_0.001 zero_hit_0.01 zero_hit_0.05 theta_hit_0.001 theta_hit_0.01 theta_hit_0.05 length_0.001 length_0.01 length_0.05 shape_0.001 shape_0.01 shape_0.05
wald 50.31977 0 0.0145908 0.6861952 0.6966232 0.7056092 0.7628042 0.7717901 0.7822182 0 0 0 0 0 0 0.0960230 0.0751669 0.0571950 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000

bc 51.59074 0 0.0142314 0.6811021 0.6934384 0.7028928 0.7592051 0.7668426 0.7771194 0 0 0 0 0 0 0.0960174 0.0734042 0.0563122 0.8080804 0.8005210 0.7983183
bca 51.59074 0 0.0142314 0.6811076 0.6934391 0.7028944 0.7592063 0.7668437 0.7771226 0 0 0 0 0 0 0.0960149 0.0734046 0.0563119 0.8082236 0.8005640 0.7983984

testthat

test_that("mean", {
  expect_equivalent(
    thetahat,
    mean_thetahat_star,
    tolerance = 0.01
  )
})
test_that("se", {
  expect_equivalent(
    se_thetahat,
    sd_thetahat_star,
    tolerance = 0.01
  )
})
test_that("2.5 is equal to cor.test", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = ci_ll,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = wald_out["ci_2.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    tolerance = 0.02
  )
})
test_that("97.5 is equal to cor.test", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = ci_ul,
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = wald_out["ci_97.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    tolerance = 0.02
  )
})
test_that("2.5", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = wald_out["ci_2.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = pc_out["ci_2.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = bc_out["ci_2.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = bca_out["ci_2.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    tolerance = 0.02
  )
})
test_that("97.5", {
  expect_equivalent(
    round(
      x = wald_out["ci_97.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = pc_out["ci_97.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = bc_out["ci_97.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    round(
      x = bca_out["ci_97.5"],
      digits = 2
    ),
    tolerance = 0.02
  )
})
